Description: Scarab made of faience, parts of base missing, perforation at one end broken through to the base. Remains of a beige glaze preserved. The division between head and prothorax is shown with a single line. The same can be said for the division between prothorax and elytra and the suture. The humeral callosities are shown with an incised triangle, the outer parts of the elytra show a second line at the side and bottom. The head is oval in shape, the clypeus is indicated but no details are visible. The side of the scarab shows a single line separating the scarab from its base plate, no legs are shown. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. Hieroglyphs show 'Imn-Ra nsw nTr.w The orientation of the seal is longitudinal as is the perforation of the object.
